bibl.note: Both words clearly refer to the flax plant. linokalãmh is a very serviceable word, as "flax" is in English, but why it did not gain currency beyond Egypt is open to speculation. émorg€w has its own peculiarity. It seems to have been localized in Attica as kind of trade name for a flax that was woven into a fine linen fabric used in women's clothing. <linokalame, amorgis>
